meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a mother in a sentimental or overprotective way.
meanings.sent1: She wore the mumsiest apron while baking cookies for her children.
meanings.sent2: The mumsiest lady at the park always had tissues and band-aids ready for any child in need.
meanings.sent3: The mumsiest teddy bear in the toy store had a tiny bandage on its paw.
meanings.sent4: Her mumsiest instincts kicked in when she saw the lost puppy on the street.
meanings.sent5: The mumsiest hug from grandma always made everything feel better.

meanings.definition: Showing excessive concern or care for others, especially in a maternal manner.
meanings.sent1: He was the mumsiest teacher, always checking on his students' well-being.
meanings.sent2: The mumsiest nurse made sure every patient had a warm blanket and a kind smile.
meanings.sent3: The mumsiest neighbor baked cookies for everyone on the block, just to spread joy.
meanings.sent4: Her mumsiest nature shone through when she organized a surprise party for her friend.
meanings.sent5: The mumsiest volunteer at the shelter spent extra time comforting the scared animals.
